its extent is made up of two halves - an 
outer & an inner. The inner half contains 
the fibres with which we are at present 
concerned. These run backwards & downwards for some 
distance & then separate from the outer capsule 
to enter the inner at its lower extremity (Fig 4.d.)
<s>This course seems very remarkable but by it 
the fibres of the inner half of the outer capsule <\s> By this means they 
are conducted back to the destination of most 
of the frontal fibres namely the thalamus. They 
join it with the common fibres of the internal 
capsule. The fibres in the outer half of the 
outer capsule are not callosal at all. They 
are derived from the oro-lingual centre 
that is to say from the 3d <s>third <\s> frontal convolution 
& margin of the operculum. They have an 
entirely different course from the former, but I 
cannot take this up at present.
